definition: to apply (ointment, powder)/to smear/to paint on
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: Apply BF1 Hair Growth Conditioner onto scalp. Gently massage for 5 minutes then rinse Off.
sentences.chinese: 把护发精华搽在头皮上，按摩5分钟，把头发洗净。

sentences.english: Objective To establish a method of microbial limit test for miconazole nitrate liniment.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立硝酸咪康唑搽剂微生物限度检查法。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE: To establish the quality standards for Xianglong liniment.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立降龙搽剂的质量标准。

sentences.english: Objective T0 study the efficacy and safety of erfukang liniment topical application in the treatment of infantile eczema.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察儿肤康搽剂治疗婴儿湿疹的疗效与安全性。

sentences.english: She powdered her face before going to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 她去参加晚宴前往脸上搽了粉。

sentences.english: Rinse pork belly, rub skin with dark soya sauce, sear skin until brown.
sentences.chinese: 五花腩原件冲净，用老抽搽抹猪皮，用白镬爆至啡色。

sentences.english: Objective To study the preparation process and quality control method of indomethacin liniment.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨吲哚美辛搽剂的制备及质量控制标准。

sentences.english: She powdered her face and applied her lipstick and rouge.
sentences.chinese: 她往脸上搽了粉，抹了口红和胭脂。

sentences.english: Louise dabbed at her face with a powder puff.
Cut eggplant, born on the affected part, can treat the centipede bites and stung.
sentences.chinese: 生茄子切开，搽患部，可治蜈蚣咬伤和蜂蜇。

sentences.english: Clean and rinse cuttlefish , wipe dry; rub with ginger wine and set aside for a while.
sentences.chinese: 墨鱼清洗干净后抺干，用姜汁酒搽匀腌片刻。

sentences.english: Every morning she rubs coldcream on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她每天早晨往脸上搽冷霜。

sentences.english: She was dabbing her cheeks with a powder-puff.

definition: to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
to paint/to smear/to apply (makeup etc)/to doodle/to erase/to obliterate
to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
